question_text:
You have a Fabric workspace that contains a data pipeline named Pipeline1 as shown in the exhibit. (Click the Exhibit tab.)



What will occur the next time Pipeline1 runs?

answers.A: Copy_kdi will run first, and then Execute procedure1 will run.
answers.B: Execute procedure1 will run first, and then Copy_kdi will run.
answers.C: Execute procedure1 will run and Copy_kdi will be skipped.
answers.D: Copy_kdi will run and Execute procedure1 will be skipped.

discussion:
I just tested this. If you set the activity state of any acitity to deactivated, it wwiwll show as inactive when run since it will be skipped over.

My first taught was E, because there is no connection between the activities and they should run both in parallel. 
However, Stored Procedure is deactivated, meaning it would not run.
So, the correct answer is D: the only copy activity would run, sp would be skipped

No need to complicate things , Stored procedure activity is inactive

Here's what happens:
If one activity (e.g., a Copy activity) is active and connected, and another (like a Stored Procedure activity) is inactive and unconnected, only the active one runs.
Inactive activities do not execute, just like in Azure Data Factory.
Unconnected activities are not part of the execution graph, so Fabric does not trigger them.

Both activities will run simultaneously.

The Execute procedure1 activity was inactive in the previous run, it does not mean that on the next one it will inactive again. There's no way of disabling an activity

buddy, what you see in the top left corner of Execute procedure1 - the crossed circle - it means that the activity is deactivated. It won't run unless you active it again
